sub_title: Passion for writing | Debut novel "Witkind" | Woman with a mission| Owner Boshuisje Speuld
summary:
Besides being an entrepreneur, I’m an writer who lived, worked and travelled in Southern Africa for a long time. During my time in Africa, I’ve lost my heart to the culture, the wilderness and wildlife, especially to the painted wolves. I write experience blogs for a renowned Dutch travel organisation, which offers luxury tailor-made trips to Africa and the rest of the world.

The African wild dog has a prominent role in my exciting debut novel "Witkind" (English title: Mlungu).
I've been writing the story of Witkind since 2017, and in 2019 I asked a well-known Dutch publisher to give me his feedback regarding the story. 

The feedback I received was: 

“ This story has potential.
The setting is good (the African bush). A strong woman who wants to get away with her family for a sabbatical to get rid of the hectic and stressful life in the Netherlands is recognizable.
The disappearance of their young daughter is the greatest nightmare that can befall a parent. The theme around the pack of painted wolves and the traditional African healers adds excitement and makes the story cultural and even more engaging. "

Well, the diamond is cut and ready to be presented to (international) publishers, organizations, and filmmakers.
